subject: Enough is enough
msgSnippet: Everyone: In the past two weeks I have received numerous unsolicited personal e-mails and even now people are contacting me directly by instant message, asking
messageBody:
Everyone:

In the past two weeks I have received numerous unsolicited personal
e-mails and even now people are contacting me directly by instant
message, asking me general questions about how to get started with JUnit.

I find this rude.

Ladies and gentlemen, I am /not/ your search engine. If you have general
questions about a topic, then go to http://www.google.com, enter a few
keywords, press the big Search button and look through a few relavent
links. Download tutorials and software, install, and try things out.

When you have tried a few things out and have some specific questions,
such as "why doesn't this work?" or "what am I doing wrong here?", then
post them here to the mailing list, where I'm sure that /someone/ (and
possibly me, depending on whether I have time at that moment) will answer.

If you are looking to hire a consultant to help your company adopt JUnit
and testing-oriented practices, then by all means, please visit the
Diaspar Software web site, the URL for which is in every message I
write. If you are looking for free help, then go to the mailing lists,
and not directly to me.

Thank you for your time.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
